This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T08:46:33Z Adrian Tribe 2015-03-11T08:46:26-00:00 2015-03-11T08:46:26-00:00 FW: National Heritage Science Forum Blog https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;c0eb7d8a.1503 This may be of interest to some list members.<br><br>Please note the VERY short lead time!<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Adrian<br><br>Adrian Tribe<br><br>conservation-research list administrator<br><br>From: Icon [mailto:ICON@technology-trust-news.org]<br>Sent: 10 March 2015 18:30<br>To: Adrian Tribe<br>Subject: National Heritage Science Forum Blog<br><br>Conservation Science Group<br>Iconnect<br><br><http://i.emlfiles1.com/cmpimg/t/s.gif><br><br><http://technology-trust-news.org/6S6-38Q6U-92ZQC2-1ICQGJ-1/c.aspx><br><br><http://i.emlfiles1.com/cmpimg/t/s.gif><br><br><http://i.emlfiles1.com/cmpimg/t/s.gif><br><br>Dear all<br><br>We are looking for bloggers to raise the profile of heritage science and to answer the question: Who are the heritage scientists? Where do they work? What do they do? What are they like? - This campaign is to coincide with Science Week, so the deadline is short I [...] Adrian Tribe 2015-03-03T08:35:24-00:00 2015-03-03T08:35:24-00:00 FW: Conservation Scientist Position at Freer Gallery of Art and Arthur M. Sackler Gallery, Smithsonian https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;c058fe4a.1503 From: Arch-Metals Group [mailto:ARCH-METALS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of<br>McCarthy, Blythe<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 21:51<br>To: ARCH-METALS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Conservation Scientist Position at Freer Gallery of Art and<br>Arthur M. Sackler Gallery, Smithsonian<br><br>The Freer Gallery of Art and Arthur M. Sackler Gallery is seeking a<br>Conservation Scientist to perform scientific research, as well as<br>identification and analyses of materials used in works of art to support<br>the efforts of the staff in the galleries. The Freer Gallery of Art and<br>Arthur M. Sackler Gallery are the Smithsonian Institution's museums of<br>Asian Art. The two Galleries are co-administered and share the same<br> [...] Adriaan Linters 2015-02-18T17:45:53+00:00 2015-02-18T17:45:53+00:00 2015 European Industrial Heritage Year https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;f8b5e93f.1502 2015... the European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year.<br>... An idea once launched by volunteers and voluntary associations now becomes reality !<br><br>INVITATION TO JOIN THE KICK-OFF MEETING IN BRUSSELS: MARCH 6th<br><br>In every European country the "European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year" is developing faster and broader than we - and many others - did or even ever could expect.<br>Everywhere initiatives are launched bottom-up by volunteers and associations. Activities and events are scheduled by grassroots organizations.<br>Many thanks to all those who now are now devoting themselves to turn the "European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year" into a [...] Adrian Tribe 2015-02-04T14:04:44-00:00 2015-02-04T14:04:44-00:00 FW: The regeneration of St Mary at the Quay church: Free technical days https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;8c754140.1502 From Rachel Barrett, Regeneration Officer at the Churches Conservation Trust.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Adrian<br><br>From: Rachel Barrett [mailto:rbarrett@thecct.org.uk]<br>Sent: 04 February 2015 09:39<br>Subject: The regeneration of St Mary at the Quay church: Free technical days<br><br><snip><br><br>The church of St Mary at the Quay (SMAQ) in Ipswich is in the process of being restored and regenerated into a Wellbeing Heritage Centre, Quay Place <http://www.quayplace.co.uk/> . [...] Catt Baum 2015-01-14T16:19:26+00:00 2015-01-14T16:19:26+00:00 Positions for Conservators at The National Archives, Kew https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;9f8c9c3e.1501 The National Archives in Kew are recruiting Project Conservators for oujr Digitisation Support Team. Applicants must be specialists in, or have experience of book, paper and/or archive conservation. For further details on the post and how to apply, please visit<br><br>http://ig24.i-grasp.com/fe/tpl_nationalarchives02.asp?s=4A515F4E5A565B1A&jobid=91514,7223724734&key=51991702&c=798699562198&pagestamp=dbqlitevqlgnbuomph<br><br>(closing date: Midnight, 20 January)<br><br>Catt Baum<br>Conservation Manager: Digitisation Services James Crawford 2014-12-18T19:42:32+00:00 2014-12-18T19:42:32+00:00 BROMEC 35 - Publication announcement https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;61bef2e.1412 *Dear Colleague,*<br><br>BROMEC 35, the Bulletin of Research on Metal Conservation is now available<br>online at the following websites:<br><br>- http://www.warwick.ac.uk/bromec<br>-<br>https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/Metals-Conservation-Discussion-Group/files<br><br>- http://www.icom-cc.org/10/documents?catId=13&subId=127<br><br>Ten research abstracts and 5 announcements are presented, together with the<br>usual lists of related contacts and informative metal research/conservation<br>websites and discussion groups.<br><br>You will find English, French and Spanish language versions for downloading<br>as PDF documents. [...] Victoria Stevens 2014-11-05T10:11:19+00:00 2014-11-05T10:11:19+00:00 Re: FW: Postprints from the Book and Paper group sessions at the Icon Positive Futures 13 conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;e1875036.1411 Hi Adrian<br><br>Thanks for this - do I need to send this on anywhere to get it posted to<br>the Conservation Research jisc list? Sorry if I am confused.<br><br>Victoria<br>On 05/11/2014 09:57, Adrian Tribe wrote:<br>> -----Original Message-----<br>> From: Victoria Stevens [mailto:victoria.stevens@magd.ox.ac.uk]<br>> Sent: 05 November 2014 09:42<br>> To: CONSERVATION-RESEARCH-request@jiscmail.ac.uk<br>> Subject: Postprints from the Book and Paper group sessions at the Icon<br>> Positive Futures 13 conference<br>><br>> Current Solutions for Mutual Issues: postprints from the Book & Paper<br>> Group sessions at the Icon Positive Futures conference 2013<br>><br>> It is with great [...] Adrian Tribe 2014-11-05T09:57:01-00:00 2014-11-05T09:57:01-00:00 FW: Postprints from the Book and Paper group sessions at the Icon Positive Futures 13 conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;e1650dfc.1411 -----Original Message-----<br>From: Victoria Stevens [mailto:victoria.stevens@magd.ox.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 05 November 2014 09:42<br>To: CONSERVATION-RESEARCH-request@jiscmail.ac.uk<br>Subject: Postprints from the Book and Paper group sessions at the Icon<br>Positive Futures 13 conference<br><br>Current Solutions for Mutual Issues: postprints from the Book & Paper<br>Group sessions at the Icon Positive Futures conference 2013<br><br>It is with great pleasure that we would like to announce that the<br>postprints from the group's sessions at Icon PF13 are now available to<br>download as a PDF from: http://thebookandpapergathering.org/ [...] Alison ,Hay 2014-10-06T13:15:00+01:00 2014-10-06T13:15:00+01:00 MatterREALITY 2014: Authenticity in Transition: Changing Practices in Contemporary Art Making and Conservation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;2dd78225.1410 MatterREALITY 2014<br><br>Authenticity in Transition: Changing Practices in Contemporary Art Making<br>and Conservation<br>> 1-2 December 2014, Glasgow School of Art, Glasgow<br>><br>> Register now for this two-day international conference! The organisers have<br>> designed an intense workshop programme in which the sessions offer short<br>> concentrated talks, with following commentary and discussion from<br>> international speakers comprising artists, curators, and other researchers<br>> debating in various ways how changing artistic practice affects our<br>> interpretation, conservation, and curation of contemporary art, with a special<br>> reference to shifting concepts of authenticity and artistic intent.<br>><br>> Organised by [...] Alison Hay 2014-10-06T10:29:41+01:00 2014-10-06T10:29:41+01:00 MatterREALITY 2014: Authenticity in Transition: Changing Practices in Contemporary Art Making and Conservation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;884f3572.1410 Authenticity in Transition: Changing Practices in Contemporary Art Making and Conservation<br>1-2 December 2014, Glasgow School of Art, Glasgow<br><br>Register now for this two-day international conference! The organisers have designed an intense workshop programme in which the sessions offer short concentrated talks, with following commentary and discussion from international speakers comprising artists, curators, and other researchers debating in various ways how changing artistic practice affects our interpretation, conservation, and curation of contemporary art, with a special reference to shifting concepts of authenticity and artistic intent. Please see text below: Athanasios Velios 2014-05-08T10:48:45+01:00 2014-05-08T10:48:45+01:00 Ligatus Summer School in historic bookbinding https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONSERVATION-RESEARCH;72d5efb7.1405 Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Ligatus Summer School 2014, Ljubljana<br><br>http://www.ligatus.org.uk/summerschool<br><br>22 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 26 September: The History of European Bookbinding 1450-1830.<br>29 September \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 3 October: Identifying and recording bookbinding<br>structures of the Eastern Mediterranean.<br>6 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 10 October: Byzantine bookbinding: a practical workshop.<br><br>This year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Ligatus Summer School will take place in the beautiful city<br>of Ljubljana in Slovenia, and will be hosted by the Archives of the<br>Republic of Slovenia.<br>The price is \ufffd\ufffd300 per week per participant, and this includes fees for<br>teaching only. Travel, food and accommodation would need to be arranged<br>individually by each student.
